author: Staff Reporter
text:
Vehicles being checked by the police personnel along withvideo surveillance at Fort Round Road in Vellore.— Photo:C. Venkatachalapathy

A static surveillance team seized Rs. 3.97 lakh from a person during a vehicle check near the Gudiyatham-Chittoor gate on Sunday. However, officials returned the cash after the man produced the required documents for carrying the cash.

Officials said the man, who was running poultry feed unit, had collected payment from his customers and was carrying the cash as the banks were closed for the weekend and he could not deposit the money.

“The static surveillance team, while carrying out vehicle checks, seized the cash from him. We returned the cash after he produced the required documents for possessing it,” an officer said.

Meanwhile, the election officials are conducting checks across the district to see if the model code of conduct is being enforced.

They are checking if wall posters/graffiti put up by political parties, and party flags were removed.

Collector R. Nanthagopal on Saturday inspected the Government Higher Secondary School, Thorapadi, to check the facilities, such as ramps, available for physically challenged persons to cast their votes on the polling day. He earlier inspected works for inclusion, deletion and correction in the electoral list at the Vellore Taluk office, a press release said.

title: Team seizes cash, returns it after verifying documents
